JobFullDesc: 2021 has been a significant year for Uber’s business in the UK. In March, we announced that all UK drivers would be treated as workers and receive additional rights and protections. These include earning at least the National Living Wage when driving with Uber, paid holiday time, and automatic enrollment into a pension plan. In May, we announced a groundbreaking trade union recognition deal with GMB, pledging to come together to improve work in the private hire sector. Reporting into the Head of Driver Operations, the Driver Engagement Lead will be responsible for developing and implementing our UK wide Worker Relations strategy. You will ideally have experience of working with trade unions, an understanding of employment issues in the UK, combined with the operational and project management experience to implement our plan to further the best interests of drivers and raise the standard of work across the whole private hire sector. This role represents an opportunity to be at the heart of one of the newest, most transformative, and innovative partnerships between a leading trade union and a global company. This role will require you to work collaboratively across a wide range of teams and functions to deliver results.  You will work closely across operational and functional teams including Policy, Communications, Community Operations, Marketing, Legal as well as the regional and HQ product & operations teams. What the Candidate Will Do;Work internationally with teams across the Uber business, in the UK, EMEA & San Francisco. Work closely with internal teams to improve policies and processes that directly impact drivers' experience on the platform.Be responsible and accountable for ensuring the success of Uber’s UK relationship with unions. Design and deliver operational the processes needed to ensure effective running of the partnership with GMB, including delivering on our commitments to consult and negotiate on issues impacting drivers.Collaborate with Safety teams to build strategies that promise best-practice safety standards that benefit drivers, riders and cities.Organise and manage driver events, roundtables and user forums, including regular forums with the union.Collaborate with internal and external experts to develop groundbreaking policy campaigns on raising the standard of work in private hire.Demonstrate thought leadership when it comes to labour issues like improving social protections for workers and health & safety.What the Candidate Will Need;A minimum of 5 years experience working in a role with direct experience in working with trade unions or industrial relations. We will also consider you if you are coming from a management consulting background and have worked heavily in the transport sector.A self starter: Uber is a company of entrepreneurs an d we want to work with people who enjoy building things from the bottom up – you’ll be an accomplished project manager. Things change fast in our world so you'll need to be highly adaptable as well as calm under pressure.An expert negotiator: An ideal candidate will know how to navigate complex partnerships, driving positive outcomes for all parties.A confident communicator: You will be just as comfortable talking to drivers as you are with data scientists, policy makers, business leaders, Union officials and operations experts.Strong stakeholder management: Success at Uber depends on the ability to organise different teams (internally and externally) around shared goals. It's why we are looking for well organised people who love working with others to get things done-and who can deal with the ambiguity that sometimes comes from working cross-functionallPolitical and regulatory acumen: You will be able to demonstrate contextual awareness of the political debate around the future of work and a working knowledge of the legal and regulatory environment around work.  We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let's move the world forward, together.
